Gregory Berezowsky wrote:
>
> No change needed other than a little HATEOAS.
> 
> Just use the existing call with Feb 29 for the year in
> consideration.  404 means its not a leap year.  Back it with the
> specified function or not as you see fit, as long as it works.
> 
> 	http://charger.bisonsystems.net/date?iso=2010-02-29
> 
> HATEOASify the whole thing by adding a link header for the above "is
> leap year" URI to related calls.  This would be assembled based on
> the year in the related call.
> 

On the A - F grading scale, this answer rates a solid B.  What I was
looking for was:  Some sort of hypertext control accepting YYYY as
input instructs the user agent to HEAD /date?iso=YYYY-02-29 and display
'YYYY is a leap year' if and only if response code = (200|304).

Glad someone posted that answer, because my purpose was to offer a tip
from hard experience -- base system logic on checking for success codes,
not failure codes, as much as possible.  Note the above URI returns 500.
Don't forget that 304 also indicates success.

More job-app pop-quiz questions to come over time, as I think of 'em.

-Eric
